schemacrawler.schema

Interface BaseColumn<D extends DatabaseObject>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AttributedObject, Comparable<NamedObject>, ContainedObject<D>, DatabaseObject, DependantObject<D>, DescribedObject, NamedObject, Serializable, TypedObject<ColumnDataType>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Column, FunctionParameter, IndexColumn, ProcedureParameter, ResultsColumn, RoutineParameter<R>, TableConstraintColumn

    public interface BaseColumn<D extends DatabaseObject>
extends DependantObject<D>, TypedObject<ColumnDataType>
    Column for tables and routines.
    Author:
    Sualeh Fatehi

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ColumnDataType getColumnDataType()
      Gets the column data type.
      int getDecimalDigits()
      Get the number of fractional digits.
      int getOrdinalPosition()
      Get the ordinal position of the column in the table, starting at 1.
      int getSize()
      Get the column size.
      String getWidth()
      Gets the width of the column, if the column width is required.
      boolean isColumnDataTypeKnown()
      Whether the column data type is known or not.
      boolean isNullable()
      Whether the column is nullable.

    • Method Detail

      • getColumnDataType

        ColumnDataType getColumnDataType()
        Gets the column data type.
        Returns:
        Column data type

      • getDecimalDigits

        int getDecimalDigits()
        Get the number of fractional digits.
        Returns:
        Number of fractional digits

      • getOrdinalPosition

        int getOrdinalPosition()
        Get the ordinal position of the column in the table, starting at 1.
        Returns:
        Ordinal position of the column in the table, starting at 1

      • getSize

        int getSize()
        Get the column size. For char or date types this is the maximum number of characters, for numeric or decimal types this is precision.
        Returns:
        Column size

      • getWidth

        String getWidth()
        Gets the width of the column, if the column width is required. (Column width is not significant for column types such as TIME and DATE.)
        Returns:
        Column width as a String

      • isColumnDataTypeKnown

        boolean isColumnDataTypeKnown()
        Whether the column data type is known or not.
        Returns:
        True if the column data type is known

      • isNullable

        boolean isNullable()
        Whether the column is nullable.
        Returns:
        Whether the column is nullable
